intro: Ornithogalum karooicum, commonly known as the Karoo star-of-Bethleem, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spherical berries that are edible for some animals. Ornithogalum karooicum is often found in fynbos vegetation and is valued for its ornamental appearance.
